name: Donna Hall
text: Rudulph managed my property for over 20 years. As a property owner, they made it super easy to get property repairs completed, screen tenants, and give good advice as needed to update the property. They follow the law with tenants and do have the property owner’s best interest. They have always been fair and I always got paid on time. Highly recommend to anyone who may be considering a property manager for their rentals.

name: Brittany Wiginton
text: I rented a house with Rudolph Realty and I have to say they are the absolute WORST company I’ve ever had to deal with. So unprofessional, unreliable, and untrustworthy. They do not have the owners best interest at heart; and definitely not the renter’s. The only way to contact them is through email, in which they don’t answer often. Had to send several follow up emails to get anything done. (Bc they don’t have a phone number to call anyone). Took two months to get my security deposit back and then they hit me with stupid charges so they didn’t have to refund the whole thing. Sooo glad to not be managed by them anymore! Just wanted to let anyone looking for a rental company know so you don’t get stuck in a contract with them and regret it.

resp.text:
Brittany,

By law, we have up to 60 days to close out the security deposit. You vacated the property during one of our busiest months of the year so it took longer than usual to get to put together the invoices and close out your file.
Overall, the move out went well except for the overpowering pet odor. The carpet cleaners you used did an insufficient job in cleaning the carpets and we had no choice but to have the carpets cleaned again.  You do not get to determine how much a company can charge for cleaning carpets.
We have responded promptly to each and every one of your email inquiries.  You seemed to have a bigger problem with not being able to call our staff and verbally berate them as you did when you 1st took possession of the home. Hostile/emotional phone calls from you to my staff were the main reasons we switched to email communication only.
We wish you the best.

name: Timothy Hall
text:
Not great: They could be hard to contact at times, but if there was an issue, maintenance was always out promptly. Some of the staff weren't very friendly, some were.
They will give you your security deposit as late as they can (& for me falsely claimed a car was parked in the yard).
They also didn't communicate with the home owner about the pet deposit they collected on the owner's behalf.
They're inflexible when it comes to business dealings. They will do what's in your contract, nothing more and nothing less.
They're far, far from a slum lord, but also far, far from the best rental agency I've worked with.

resp.text: Tim, we appreciate the kind words. I hate to here you had somewhat of a bad experience.  You are correct about being inflexible.  We follow the  Alabama Landlord Tenant Act.  All tenants are held to the same standard when renting a home and when they vacate.  We try to process the security deposit refunds as quickly as possible and sometimes the we use most of the 60 days given by the Alabama Landlord Tenant Act. I'll research your comment about the pet fee.  If a pet was listed on your application, you would have paid a non-refundable $200 pet fee at the time you took possession.  Any funds collected would be credited to the home owner's account.

For instance, my requirements were very particular; I wanted a house with a yard for my pet, full of charm and walking distance to restaurants and groceries. Amazingly enough, there was a house available with my criteria. I could not be any happier here. name: Sean Isaacs
text:
I've rented for over 10 years and have never had a place require an application or a "fee" just to look at a property. This should have been a sign of how they were to work with, but we tried it anyway.

We filled out their application, paid their fee, and looked at the home. It needed a lot of work done. The floors were really scratched up, the walls had holes in them, the patchwork and paint work looked like it was done by a child. Not to mention this property hadn't been cleaned in a long time.

Their application packet came with an offer page. I made a reasonable offer, asking for a small discount to forgo them fixing the floors, paintwork, and cleaning. They said they were "insulted" by my offer and wanted nothing to do with us a applicants.

They told us if we followed their process, it would work out. Well, it didn't. And now we are stuck with finding a new place to live and only have a few days to do so.

resp.text:
Seen (or Sean),
Let's review the timeline of events.
You initially come into our office and had issues with the fact that you must pre-qualify in order to check out keys to view the property.  We do this to ensure that neither you or our staff have to waste their time if a potential renter has an unsatisfactory credit score.
You boldly stated that you are a car salesman and "you know how to negotiate".
After speaking with you about your concerns where you may or may not qualify, you were instructed to turn in the application so we could process it and determine if we could rent to you and your family.
You offered $1,300/month on a $1,650/month rental and you demanded that my client waive the February and March rental payments.
I took your offer to the owner who informed me that he was insulted by your offer and would not consider you as a renter.
Keep in mind, you came to us.  You may be a car salesman but my client is not buying a car.
You were not charged the full application fees.  We did everything we could to work with you.  I'm sorry you are scrambling for a home and we wish you the best of luck moving forward.

name: Terri Nicole
text:
What a great team of professionals! We rented from Rudulph for 3 years and were immensely pleased with them from start to finish. That is saying a lot because there were issues with the property owner not meeting the standard of maintenance that Rudulph requires on several occasions. Each time, Rudulph did everything in its power to encourage the owner to comply.  Eventually, Rudulph decided to end its relationship with the owner, which made sense to us as  well.

Upon move out, the owner sued us for $3,500.00 in trumped up damages. Instead of leaving us high and dry, Rudulph took care of us and we only had to pay our security deposit, which was fair. We could not have asked for more support from any company.

If you are thinking of renting from Rudulph, I can assure you they operate with integrity and truly look out for their tenants. We are now looking to rent again and of course, we would not consider using anyone else but Rudy and his team of caring, knowledgeable professionals.

resp.text: Thank you so very much.  It was great to run into you today.  I'm glad it all worked out in the end.  Looking forward to working with you again.

name: Coleysia
text:
Terrible company that lacks integrity. I am currently moving out of an apartment and I pay $1200 for my rent. I was inquiring about a townhouse they have listed for $1200 (I’m thinking same price, more space, makes sense). I thought this would be a simple transaction but boy was I wrong. I submitted an application and the security deposit (equal to one months rent). I passed the credit check, employment/ salary verification, and rental verification. You would think that would be enough to enter a contract.

My application was denied because the owner didn’t feel comfortable renting to me because I’m on (unpaid) maternity leave. I return back to work in August ( which was confirmed by my job). To prove I was secure financially, I offered to pay July and August rent to ease concerns. The owner still didn’t feel comfortable. I called back and offered to pay up until October (4 months). The owner still didn’t feel comfortable renting to me. At that point I knew I could offer to pay up the entire lease and it wouldn’t matter, because it wasn’t about maternity leave.

I was told negative things about this company prior to my inquiry but I decided to try them out anyway. I see this is just the way these people are. I’m not going to make accusations but I’m a well educated, professional, African American woman. Draw your own conclusions.

resp.text:
C C,
You were turned down because you did not meet our posted minimum requirements.
1) Combined monthly income of 3 x the monthly rent in garnishable wages.
2) Minimum credit score of 600 for all adults to be considered.  Having a 600 credit score does not guarantee that you will be accepted but your application will be considered based on the other criteria.
You were initially turned down because you did not meet the combined income of 3 x the monthly rent in garnishable income.  The other adult on the application reported no income on their application.  You and I spoke on the phone and you asked me if you could pay several months up front to cover the time until you went back to work.  I called the owner last night and reviewed the application with him and gave him your offer.  He said he did not feel comfortable accepting the application based on the information that was given.

name: S B
text:
I don’t want to go into complicated details, but what I will say is that miscommunication has now cost me a great deal of money. ($10k+) I will also recommend to anyone using this company: that any communication be done ALL in writing.

What’s even sadder is that after renting/selling my home with them for years, my side of the story was considered a LIE & there was no attempt to keep me as a customer. To say I am disappointed is a huge understatement. I also just think that people should treat others better.

resp.text:
Ma'am,
The details are not complicated.    We had a roofing company ready to take care of what needed to be done after the adjuster went to your home.  Your father said he had a buddy who was a roofer who could handle the issue.  Your father's roofer is to blame for not removing the wet/molded insulation in the attic.  Your father's roofers did not put the gutters back on after the repair.  You asked us to handle.  Our contractor said the roofer did a sub-par job. You asked us to send everything to your father.  We did as you asked and he blamed us for what his roofers failed to do. You asked us to handle the interior repairs.  Our contractor handled the repairs from the ceiling down (patch and paint).  As we were not provided a copy of the adjuster's report, we had no way to know what was going on in the attic. We are certain you were paid for mold removal/remediation yet you never received a bill/estimate for mold removal/remediation from our contractors. This is an unfortunate series of events that I would like to help you with however you feel the only remedy is for me to take responsibility for something that was mismanaged by you.  You have a claim against the roofing company.  Have you contacted them about this?  It seems that it is easier for you to lash out at us instead of taking the necessary steps to hold the person(s) responsible who dropped the ball. I enjoyed working with you and I hate to end the relationship under these circumstances.
Rudy Rudulph
Property Manager

Upon moving out they charged me for trash under the house that was there when I moved it. Also changed me over 400 in pet cleaning fees that were not disclosed at time of lease. I also had to wait for over 2 month for the little bit of security deposit I did get back. Just not upfront and honest about stuff. 😡

name: Cyndy Gurley
text:
I was extremely happy with this company up until just recently (hence the 3 star). I have been renting with them for around 14 months now. If you qualify and meet their standards they are wonderful to work with. If you are paying your rent in full and on time, they will go above and beyond to meet your needs. However, if there is an unexpected life turn, even notifying them will not help. I was laid off at work and could no longer afford the rent. Even their qualifications say that you must make 3x the rent in a months time. I now make less than 2x the rent. I notified them of my life changes thinking that was right thing to do, but as I had forgotten, just remember they have a contract in place and that is what they will go by like any other business. They are still a great company despite my disagreements and misunderstandings on some of their business practices, but if are going into renting with them knowing there is even a possibility of financial changes in your life, I would not recommend them.

Adding in response to owners reply. They did offer me release option, but ultimately that is continuing to pay the rent in full as usual until it is released, sold, or until end of your lease (which ever comes first). This is extremely risky option for someone who cannot afford the rent in the first place. Can’t afford their rent, but they want you to pay two rents while waiting for them to find another person to lease. Great idea guys. Even when I offered to pay 3 months rent, plus them keeping deposit to end lease ( 6400 total).  They claim they can get it leased in a month or two (3200 total) so why not take the 6400 total and let me go? Hmmm, wonder if it’s because they cannot/ or don’t try to immediately lease it out??? Just a thought. You have to move out before they will begin to show, again paying two rents. Not a great option when I cannot afford their rent, so no that’s not helpful as he claims. Not sure how that helps me at all as they are “helping me out of a bad situation”. And I have signed and returned the release option papers, so I am unaware of what that is about. I even got confirmation emails they were received, which I am happy to provide to anyone showing the dates of his post vs the dates of the emails. Also, I highly doubt I am the only person that has gotten frustrated from being in a financially binding situation, so not sure how that deems me the most difficult with this type situation. Again, great company, until you are in a financial situation where you cannot make rent.

Update on this (today 7/30/19), as if the owner below saying I did not sign and return the forms in June wasn’t enough, just got a call saying they did not have the forms (supposedly) and could not process anything. I told them I had email confirmation that all forms were received and would be glad to forward that over. Was told that worker was on maternity leave and they could not access email to get the forms. Not sure how that’s my problem??? But sure, I’ll redo everything again since you cannot properly arrange cover while employees are out on leave. 😄

resp.text:
Cindy,
Thank you for clarifying the fact that we hold renters to the agreement that they signed.  You did not include the part where we gave you the choice of a re-leasing agreement that you, as of today, have not signed because you would rather us let you out of your lease.  We understand that people run into financial hardships and we do this sort of deal at least 10 times a year.  We have never had someone react as you have reacted.  Keep in mind, we are trying to work with you to help you get out of a bad situation.

name: lindsey hutchens
text: A misunderstanding meant we had to pay for a door repair because it looked like someone had tried to break in the apartment we'd been living in for about a year and a half.  We weren't sure - the door frame just splintered one day when opening, leaving the lock virtually useless. (The door was not in particularly good shape when we moved in.) We didn't file a police report as there was no evidence that a break in had actually occurred. When Rudulph repaired it and didn't charge us, we thought there was no issue, since nowhere in our lease did it indicate a police report would be necessary. We were a little shocked when we moved out several months later and over $400 was deducted from our deposit specifically for the repair of the door - without prior notification by the property manager of the cost of the repair, which only included a new deadbolt and a patch fix to the door and frame. Upon speaking with Mr. Rudulph, this was how they recouped their investment in the door repair. Maybe this is standard procedure for most leasing agencies, but it seems like bad practice to require your tenants to involve law enforcement before you will pay for repairs to damage they did not cause and that, if not addressed, could endanger their safety.

resp.text:
Lindsey,

I appreciate your thoughts.  It is standard policy that any time a tenant reports a break-in, we require them to send us a copy of the police report as soon as possible to justify the cost of sending a contractor to fix the door.  I explained this to you guys at the time of the incident and trusted that we would receive the police report after a few days.
Rudy

name: copper penny
text:
While Eric was professional when I met with him, I have to admit that the offer was an absolute lowball.  House needed 15k in work, but market value (looking at comps) is somewhere around $200+k, they offered $70K less than that.  I understand that investors are looking to make big profits, but I think the piece of the pie they wanted was just too big to work around.

There is a convenience factor in dealing with "We buy houses in any condition", just don't expect to get anywhere close to what your home is really worth.  Consult with a real estate agent in addition to them to get the whole picture.  A few thousand bucks in repairs may mean tens of thousands in return.  Market is red hot (both rental and sales) right now and homes are worth more than you would think.  Again, talk to a real estate agent as well if you are considering this route.

resp.text:
Hi,

Thank you for letting us know about your experience with Eric. I’m glad to hear that he acted professionally when you met with him. I’ll be sure to let him know that aspect of his work is appreciated!

Sounds like we could be a bit better when it comes to our offer. Sorry we fell short there. As real estate investors, we inherently take on risk when buying houses and need a return on our time and money invested. We aren't the best solution for everyone, especially owners who have the time, money, and experience to make repairs to the property themselves. We are sorry we couldn't work together and wish you the best of luck selling.

In the meantime, if there’s anything else you want to share with us, you can message us at info@montgomeryrealestatebuyers.com.

Thanks again!
Joseph Back, Owner

resp.text: Free Forme, thank you for your comment. Our company takes allegations of this nature very seriously. We provide equal housing opportunities to all people, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, handicap, familial status, national origin, sexual orientation or gender identity. Our staff are trained to be responsive to our callers at all times. Very rarely, a caller becomes verbally abusive. If this happens, our staff are empowered to warn the caller about any abusive language used before disconnecting the call. Our president, Chip Watts, is available to discuss this or any other issues you or any other viewers of this review may have. His direct line is 205-703-4277.

name: Xuan Huang
text:
We highly recommend Watts Realty Company.

Mr David Watts was our agent when we started to search for commercial property in downtown Birmingham. We were extremely picky in what we want, and because this was our first real estate investment, we were extremely cautious - for every property that interested us, we made multiple visits. In other words, David was not having an easy job being our agent, however, he showed great patience and understanding toward us. As the first-timers, we had A LOT of questions about properties, inspections, regulations, property management, etc, and David Watts always gave us satisfactory answers or referred us to other professionals. He assisted us in every step and met with us as soon as we sent in requests. With David's help, we found and purchased a property we loved, and it may not have happened if we worked with someone else.

Last but least, we are thankful the the entire Watts company crew who helped us arrange the meetings, look up some paperwork, buy the insurance, etc. We highly recommend Watts company and we are thankful that David was our agent.

The lady at the desk informed me that the apartment wasn't ready yet but I told her that was  aware and just putting in my application early so it could be processing because I had really needed the apartment. I put in my application that morning and around 3 the same day was denied the apartment by a lady in your office. She told me they would be sending me the papers why i was denied and never received them. resp.text: Ms. Wilson (Jenkins), thank you for providing us with your "real name" so we can address this issue to you. Our application process usually takes approximately 48 hours to complete. As such, we do not deny applicants on the same day.  We mailed a formal letter to you via USPS that explains what information was used in regards to your application. That letter also provides contact information for the consumer-reporting agency that prepared your Investigative Consumer Report. You have a right to a free copy of the report and to dispute the completeness of accuracy of any information in the consumer report with the consumer-reporting agency.

name: Justin Forbes
text:
If negative 5 stars was an option, I would choose that. David Watts is a property manager there who blatantly violated my rights under the Alabama Uniform Residential Landlord and Tenant Act as well as several articles of his own professional code of ethics as a Certified Property Manager. If you want to receive the respect you deserve as a tenant and have your rights upheld, do yourself a favor and never rent from this company.

Hi Michael,

It's nice to hear your rationalizations in defense of your younger brother's behavior, but I am more interested in the opinions of the Jefferson County Court of Law and the IREM ethics board.

resp.text: Mr. Forbes, we appreciate you taking the time to rate our company and provide a review.  After reviewing your concerns and your lease, we have determined that there have been no violations of the Alabama URLTA or the professional Code of Ethics to which our company adheres. Based on the documented emails and telephone calls between you, your wife (Ms. Galang) and our office, we attempted to schedule the shower leak repair multiple times during a time when you or your wife would be present. Unfortunately, due to several miscommunications by both parties (including third-party contractors unrelated to our company), this leak was elevated to an emergency status that would allow access to be granted without your presence and/or permission under the Alabama URLTA. Upon entering the premises, multiple other lease violations were then noted, including the presence of multiple breeds of pets that previously were not disclosed by you or your wife.  We understand your concern about our respect for our residents and their rights; however, the owners of the property also have rights under Alabama URLTA. After an extended period of time not being able to schedule a time when all parties could be present, the owner’s rights to protect the property from continued damage were enforced. We do appreciate your tenancy since mid-May 2018 and apologize that our relationship has degraded in the short time you have been a resident in Alabama. Hopefully, we may be able to better serve you in the future and avoid further miscommunications.

name: gcouogluhgit.Jasmine vWilliams
text: Very unprofessional! I started out renting a home from them then one day out the blue they sold the home.. Like are you serious I pretty sure selling wasn't last minute for them so why not let me know as well. Not only that the people they sold to tried to jack up my rent and never fixed anything!

resp.text:
Ms. Williams,

We appreciated you as a Tenant during your time with us.  However, we do not appreciate the 1 star and misplaced Google review.  Please recognize the following points.

1)	Watts Realty does not own property.  We manage for many different third parties.  Your lease document would have the name of the Landlord when it was under our management.
2)	Investment properties are sold in the normal course of business every day across the globe.  We cannot control our Clients’ decision to sell their own property(ies).   Sometimes Watts Realty isn’t involved with the sale transaction, only to receive notice the day of a sale.
3)	Investment sales fall through in the normal course of business every day across the globe.  We cannot notify Tenants of the numerous potential transactions, especially when many never coming to fruition.  Due diligence periods extend to the date of Closing in many, many cases.
4)	The property in which you reside was sold over 18 months ago in May of 2016.  We promptly notified you of the sale, and have not been associated with that property since May of 2016.
5)	Due to this Google review, we contacted your Landlord just to inquire about the situation. We have no involvement or contribution with your problems with your Landlord.  We do not manage the property, nor are they a Client of Watts Realty. Please do not misplace your frustration on us. You need to work with your Landlord to resolve those issues.

name: Amanda Johnson
text: Thought I found a great property but took forever to get stuff fixed and now that I have moved, they are siding with the landlord to try and get me to pay for stuff that I am not responsible for. Stuff that was not even in the lease. I figured keeping my deposit would be enough but no they want more money.

name: Cris Galang
text: DO NOT RENT HERE. THEIR LOW STAR RATING SAYS IT ALL. These are horrible people who treated me and my husband with such disrespect. It seems like they are nice to you if you let them manage your property but they treat renters differently. It took them 3 weeks to repair leak from upstairs shower (obviously not emergent to them, didnt even bother following up the first week if the plumber they hired came and did the job). Then persisted in entering our home without prior notice even when we explicitly didnt give them permission to do so, clearly a violation of our privacy.

resp.text: Ms. Galang, we appreciate you taking the time to rate our company and provide a review.  After reviewing your concerns, we have determined that there have been no violations of your privacy outside of the lease terms you agreed to adhere by. After you reported the leak on Sunday, May 27, during the Memorial Day weekend, the leak was assigned to a third-party contractor for completion. Regrettably, the shower drain requires a special tool to repair and the contractor did not have such tool available at the time they were on the property on May 27 (the same day you reported the leak). Based on the documented emails and telephone calls between you, your husband (Mr. Forbes) and our office, we attempted to reschedule the shower leak repair multiple times during a time when you or your husband would be present. Unfortunately, due to several miscommunications by the parties involved, this leak was elevated to an emergency status that would allow access to be granted without your presence and/or permission as per the terms of your lease. We entered your premises on June 8, less than two weeks after you reported the leak, to complete the repair by the contractor while being supervised by one of our employees. After we entered your premises, several lease violations were then noted - including the presence of multiple breeds of pets that previously were not disclosed by you or your husband.  We understand your concern about our respect for our residents and their rights; however, the owners of the property also have a responsibility and rights to protect their property (and your home). After an extended period of time not being able to schedule a time when all parties could be present, the owner’s rights to protect the property from continued damage from the leak were enforced - which triggered other property rights issues that we are attempting to work with you for you to bring into compliance with the terms of our lease. We do appreciate your tenancy since mid-May 2018 and apologize that our relationship has degraded in the short time you have been a resident in Alabama. Hopefully, we may be able to better serve you in the future and avoid any further miscommunications or lease violations.

text: Was VERY uncomfortable with the request for my credit card information to view property! All other realtors gave lockbox code or met us for showing. The property and neighborhood was mediocre at best. Scammers??

resp.text: We utilize an automated showing system called Rently for the convenience of prospective tenants on the go and don't have the time to schedule a walk through with our residential property manager.  The credit card information is for security purposes to verify your identity.  It is only a $0.99 charge that allows you access to up to 20 homes that utilize the Rently system or 30 days, whichever comes first.   If you do not feel comfortable using your credit card, please call us and let us know that is the case and we can provide you access by gathering additional identifying information from you.  If you want to walk through with an agent, please call us and schedule a time to do so.  I hope that clears up any confusion.

name: Jason Ryu
text:
Do not expect to get your security deposit back. RW does not protect tenant's security deposit.
They let my landlord withdraw my security deposit, without giving me any contact or information about deduction, even after, I contact them more than 15 times and it all happens after I go through moving out inspection and evict.
I requested refund or the evidence of maintenance which I'm obviously not responsible(Can't even tell it really happend), every single email or call I make them, gave me the same answer(check posted photo).
So basically, if you rent place through this company, land lord can make up some reasons after you evict, and before you receive your security deposit, they can simply withdraw it without your authorization, and just ghost you, wonderful experience!

resp.text: The property owner determines any and all charges that are assessed during the move out. Our disposition manager spoke with you after you had concerns with the charges that the property owner assessed. You provided our office your written dispute of the security deposit. The disposition manager was able to send your dispute to the homeowner for their determination. Upon review, the property owner feels the amounts withheld are justified and no adjustments will be made. This is the property owner’s final decision and, unfortunately, there is no further action that Renters Warehouse can take on your behalf in regards to this dispute.

name: Jay Baxter
text: Today I sat down in front of the TV to eat some breakfast... and that's when I discovered a tornado and dangerously strong winds had hit one of the places my family purchased rental properties. Be careful

resp.text: Hilary, our apologies for the delay in our response. Due to the COVID-19 situation, Google delayed publishing user reviews and are now gradually publishing these reviews, thank you for your patience. I am sorry to hear that you experienced these issues. Your lease began on April 1st. On April 6th you contacted us with complaints about the smell of mold and the condition of the water heater. We considered this to be an emergency case and immediately contacted the homeowner. A vendor was approved to visit the property. Upon inspection the tech found no odor that would be related to organic matter. The home was in need of a good cleaning but there were no visible signs of organic matter as well. The water heater was unable to be checked due to no power being on in the home, the tech did check for leaks and found none in its current state. Other issues throughout the home were noted and included in an estimate, the owner approved for all repairs to be made at your earliest convenience. You refused to schedule with the vendor and requested to terminate the lease. The owner approved your request on April 15th, we are currently in the process of closing your account. If you have any questions please contact our office at 844-793-4948, we will be happy to assist.

resp.text: Hello Miles, you had a tenant placed in the home on 2/8/2018 and they were evicted from the home on 10/4/2018. After they were required to vacate the premises the disposition was proceeded with. The charges assessed to the past tenant exceeded the security deposit funds. The security deposit totaling $950.00 was to be sent to you as the homeowner. However, this balance was applied towards the outstanding balances on your account. The following charges on your account were the following; $55.00 for an estimate fee, management fees from June - October, and a portion of your re-keying of the property. Please be advised, their is still a balance owed on your account for this re-key of the property. Please submit a payment for this outstanding balance on your account. If you have additional questions please contact our office at 844-793-4948 and we will be happy to assist you.

text: During the moratorium set forth by president Biden, this company has decided to through a family out on the street even though they have followed the guidelines set forth by the president and cdc and was promised to pay in full once they got the money at the end of the month. Great, down home, friendly real estate agency.

name: charleta king
text: I placed a rental application with this company. I never received a  follow up call regarding their properties available or status of my application. I called a number of times and either they were not available or I was told they would return my call (which did not occur).  I follow up today only to be advised that my application was not approved. I would not recommend.

name: Nope Nope
text: It seems kind of crook like to make people pay to apply for properties they may not even be able to accept because they have pets.  Please consider getting that information available to prospective tenants prior to the application process so you're not taking people's hard earned money and making them gamble.  They have beautiful properties, but I will use a different service and recommend other pet owners use a different service due to this.  $30/application with the risk of not knowing whether or not the property takes our family members?  No thank you.

text: Welcoming environment.  Great rental company to deal with.  They made my transition to my first apartment as easy on me as possible. text: Josh & the crew at Bradford are awesome.  they helped me find a place to live when I was down and out and took care of me the entire time I lived there.  they go above and beyond for anyone who walks through their front door.  they're also very supportive in the community and I like to support those who give back.  thumbs up for Bradford realty.

text: rented from this co for 6 years while I lived in Montevallo.  great to work with.  never had any major maintenance problems that they didn't take care of right away.  always kind and friendly and glad to help in whatever way possible.  lots of my friends rented from them as well.  would highly recommend.

name: Bowbee Outdoors
text: Josh is disrespectful to customers. Maitnance is nonexistent. If ac goes out expect 3 days minimum before anyone even looks. Flood in your ground level apt? Not there problem for at least a week. Plenty of other options. I rather blowtorch my nipples off than deal with this company again.

name: Bethany Aucoin
text: I have been renting an apartment from Bradford for almost a year now and I have absolutely no complaints. I have noticed other people complaining about their discrimination or problems, but as a lesbian couple in the south, we have had nothing but pleasant conversations with the employees and they have always been happy to help us with whatever we may need. Our house could have been in better shape when we moved in, but the few issues that we have had have been taken care of by the employees promptly. They are all very nice people and I always have the best conversations with the lady at the front desk.

name: Sal Vagal
text: FANTASTIC Rental agency! I wish I could pick them up and take them with me.  They've been nothing but an absolute pleasure to work with.  I've read negative reviews but completely believe what you put in is what you get out.  I never had an issue that wasn't promptly corrected, never called and had anyone be rude to me.  They were always a pleasure.  I feel like in this world people think they can be rude and ugly to people in the service industry and expect them not to be rude back.....

text: These folks were a pleasure to work with. I’d recommend them highly. Great to work with. Always going above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of and happy

name: Brooke Morgan
text: Do not trust this company. The house we rented from them was destroyed when we moved in—so my parents and I had to fix it up all on our own: repairs in the walls, the floors, the fixtures. It’s ridiculous. Not to mention, many people at Bradford are extremely rude and make my roommates and I feel inferior for even asking a question. Do NOT come to Bradford Real Estate. Find someone else who is worth your time, money, and cares about you genuinely as customers.

name: Penelope Wallace
text: I'd give them 10 Stars! They're all amazing to work with, Jeannie is super friend and Josh has always been on point.  They've been nothing but helpful and accommodating in everyway.  I wish all rental managers were this awesome! Thanks for making Montevallo an awesome place!

name: Tonya Young
text: Awesome folks! I don't know why anyone would ever complain about them!  They're timely and courteous and are always awesome to work with.

name: Apricot Pearson
text: Great folks- would highly recommend working with them.  They represent lots of good properties.

name: Jackson Pearson
text: I could not possibly agree more with the negative comments that I've read on here. I've lived in three of Bradford's properties over the last 10 years and have only positive things to say about them.  They're open Monday-Friday 9-5, just like their website says they are.  I will say that I've called within those hours and had to leave a message before but they've always called me back.  They have an email address for emergency maintenance which they've always been responsive to as far as I am concerned at least.  The people who work there are always polite and helpful.  I've had issues with bugs in the past as well but they sent an exterminator over for an extra spray a couple of times between the regular monthly spray and the issue was taken care of.  The guys who do their maintenance seem very nice.  They've surely never been rude or disrespectful.  I've had a couple of situations where they came to fix something and didn't have all of the parts the needed, so they had to leave and come back- once even hey had to order a part and it didn't come until the next day, but they seem to be qualified and have always made repairs that meet my standards.   I've surely never been made to feel as if they don't care about me or my issues.  I see them at least once per month to pay rents. I always have a delightful conversation with Jenny who works the front desk.  She is always kind to ask about my family and my life.  This business is very community oriented and involved in most every event that goes on in Montevallo.  I always see that they've sponsored little league and parades and festival and food drives.  I just can't imagine anything than that the people who have left negative comments created negative situations for themselves.  I'd even go so far as to say that this company goes above and beyond for their tenants.  Josh even came by to check on my heater one year on thanksgiving night because it had been giving me some issues that week.  anyone that is going to come out after hours and on a holiday just to make sure my family and I aren't cold is ok by me.  I'd give these people 10 stars if it was an option.

name: Christie Albergine
text: I️ had a great e patience with these people. I️ have to imagine for those that didn’t that it was their own fault.

name: Reckless Love
text: Applied for a rental house with a co-signer that was within my price range, paid the application fee, only for them to waste 3 day of my time after being told my the agent that there should be no problem getting approved. I constantly felt an air of discrimination from the front desk secretary. multiple times I was refused to speak with my agent. I was quoted a timeframe of 12 hours, it has been 3 days and they refuse to work with me. This company has lied to me, wasted my time, and now put me at a severe disadvantage with less than 24 hours to find a place to go. Gina is overall unpleasant to work with and Josh refuses to speak with clients. The power of approval is in a single mans hands (josh). there is no regulated system, but seemingly approving or denying basred of opinions of the person. the entire time I felt I was being pushed away and like they were trying to keep me out. UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHOULD YOU GIVE THIS COMPANY YOUR BUSINESS.

name: Ouida Brackett
text: I called to deal with an issue of the company putting a check through on my account that was post dated. When I initially asked the front desk clerk if it would be okay to pay my 1st months rent,  and since I was there, give her a check for the upcoming months rent. I don't live in Montevallo and the property I was renting was in Alabaster. So since you can't pay rent online, I gave the post dated check so that I wouldn't have to drive back to Montevallo. I was assured TWICE by the clerk that this was okay. Fast forward after I paid my initial deposit as well as first month's rent. They decided to also deposit my post dated check for the upcoming month. Leaving me with an NSF due to the fact that the postdated amount wasn't accounted for in my monthly budget. ESPECIALLY after you already received $2,000 from me within a weeks time. I called and spoke with JOSH who verbally assaulted me and basically called me a criminal for writing bad checks. After he informed me that it's not their policy to take a post dated check and he doesn't know where I got that info from. I LITERALLY GOT IT FROM THE FRONT DESK  CLERK!!!! HE took no ownership, did not apologize, complained about a $50 fee he would have to pay b/c of my returned check and then hung up in my face. The crazy thing about this whole situation is that the check cleared on my end. My bank LITERALLY cleared the check and just charged me an NSF fee. All I wanted was my $30 back. He didn't even have the human decency to listen to what I was telling him before becoming beligerent!! This company is the absolute worst that I have ever dealt with in my life. And my husband is military so we have moved and dealt with numerous companies. RUN...DON'T WALK AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!!!

name: Jansen Arceneaux
text: If you enjoy rental companies without an after hours line, customer service agents that will lie to you about appointments and then call you the liar when confronted than this is the place for you! Worst rental experience I've had in a long time. This is a small town, small family, small minded company. They truely don't care about you. From a customer service standpoint I was so dissapointed. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere. Also they do not do electronic payments!!! This is the 21st century Bradford!! Try and keep up 😉

name: Justin Kirk
text:
I’m not sure what you’re referring to that says in any way that we indicated the property wasn’t nasty from the start. The checklist we completed upon move in said the kitchen was filthy and hadn’t been cleaned, the walls needed paint, noted the broken electrical outlets and the nails/holes left from the previous tenant. We had to SCRUB this place. Not to mention all the spiders we dealt with for a month because you hadn’t been taking care of pest control. We would have noted the uncontrollable bamboo, but it was February and it wasn’t growing in the cold months. How can you even begin to think we caused a bamboo problem? The owner himself said he had tried to get rid of it “for years”. Exact words. Once again he himself saw the yard mowed before we moved out. When I went to check the yard on 5/13, it had not been TOUCHED since we left. All you do is blame your negligence on other people. From the yard to the unmanaged interior.

The water infiltration issue in the BEDROOM FLOOR was not due to “massive flooding”. EVERY TIME IT RAINED, water came through the flooring. And EVERY TIME it happened, you were notified and offered zero assistance in fixing the issue. This is not something that happened just once. I will be sure to find the business card from the man who came out from community development and assured me that if I called him the next time there was visible water coming through that he could see with his own eyes that they would condemn the house until the issue was fixed. I also have two other witnesses who were at the house for that conversation. We told them not to worry about it because we were getting out of the house to which he said “I don’t blame you, I’d hire an attorney”. He also said that a mold expert would need to come out to test the MOLD AND MUSHROOMS. Even your maintenance man left the house to get himself a mask so that he wouldn’t be breathing in the mold when you sent him to the house after LYING saying that YOU would send a mold expert out. This is all documented. Every single bit of it. You “allowed” us to move out because you knew you were caught. Anyone with common sense will be able to see that. You said yourself “the mold will dry out. It’s about to be warm outside”.

You can try to justify it all you want, but mushrooms growing in a bedroom is not normal. I was sick for a solid week after stirring it up while moving.

Not fixing a water infiltration issue that you’ve known about for who knows how long? Negligent, irresponsible.

Bottom line- I’m not here to argue with you as it clearly gets us nowhere. That’s what attorneys are for. I can back up everything I’ve stated, unlike you. I’m here to warn other people of the sorry excuse of a landlord you are.

Again people, trust the negative reviews. I have no doubt in my mind that every single one directed toward Darin Bashaw is true. I’m willing to bet all my stolen money on it.

resp.text:
Mr Kirk once  again I am sorry that you were unhappy with home. We repaired the few minor items called out by the city in a few hours. This home has been under our management for years with no one else having the same issues you reported. You threatened legal action and we advised you of our attorney’s information. I truly wish you and your family all the best of luck.
Sharon

name: Briana Wilson
text: this business is a joke. I think its funny how all the reviews are the same with even more added nasty. lol its always the tenants. these units are trash the company is trash and so are the people. save your best of luck speech or whatever it is that's copied and pasted as a response. <3

name: William L.
text: I'd looked at a property, got approved for the rental then right out of nowhere as I was going to pay the deposit the agent Darin rented it to someone else. I got no explanation of any type to why I was ultimately screwed over. DO NOT use this unprofessional company

resp.text: It wasn't really out of nowhere. We require a hold fee paid within 24 hours to secure the property. In this case the hold fee wasn't attempted for over 3 days. Until the hold fee is paid, a home is still very active and very available to anyone who can get the hold fee in first. It's not fair to other people for us to have to guess that someone is still interested when other customers are willing to place the hold fee.

name: Rejeana Morgan
text: Lived in a rental house for 4 years. Paint was rubbing/ peeling off a bedroom wall. We finally moved! After we moved they rented the property in SE Huntsville with in less than a month and our old neighbors has informed us that Huntsville property management never bothered to repaint the interior of house before moving others into property during Covid! Nasty management company.

As the property manager we make sure every unit we manage is fully cleaned and disinfected after tenant change, per COVID guidelines.
Just as an FYI since you may not have talked to the new tenants; they needed to move into the unit immediately and agreed to take it without getting fixed up or painted.

name: Trudy Harris
text: I have rented from this company in the past, I received the best customer service from the staff in the office as well as the maintenance crew, they have always came out in a timely manner to repair any issues. The Property Manager was always available to speak with me or get back with me at his earliest convenience. If I did not have to move out of town, I will still be there. You Guys Rock!!

name: Thomas Geeslin
text: Had a issue with my house when we first moved in and they addressed it immediately and when we had another problem it took over a week and several calls and a email. They called me back, the property manager was personable and seemed very willing to take care of the problem. I haven’t had a chance to recheck the problem yet but was told that they would handle the problem we are having as soon as possible.

resp.text:
Mr. Geeslin, I am at a loss as to where this bad impression is coming from. You only a few weeks ago moved into one of our beautiful Madison rentals. There has been only one service request in the tenant portal for no heat, which was addressed promptly and had to do with the gas being still shut off at meter. No other complaints or maintenance issues were submitted that I am aware of. I did get the message from the office late on Monday and called the very next day to find out about your needing a working key for one of the 6 locks. It was a normal, pleasant conversation. So, I don't know why you are left thinking I am anything other than a normal and pleasant person . Sorry for the bad impression and that it took me a couple of days to get back to you over that weekend, but I rarely work in the office and provide my cell phone number to all owners and tenants, so I can be reached in urgent situations. I explained that we have keys, I personally tried the keys and they worked in all the locks. But, copies were made of our masters and maybe one was cut wrong? No big deal, just text me the lock that you don't have a working key for as I requested and I will get you new copies. I have yet to receive this text, so can only assume the keys worked after all. HPM and myself strive to always provide the best and promptest service.
-Darin

name: Lawaina Simpson
text: Moved here from Florida to a great apartment. Have been in my apartment now for 3 years and I love it. The staff are all very nice and my apartment is beautiful!

resp.text: Thanks Ms. Simpson, we appreciate your honest review!

name: Allison Hubbard
text:
Its hard to post a negative review without sounding like a disgruntled tenant; however, I just don't think this company know how to manage properties effectively. I had several maintenance issues that were extremely difficult to get repaired simply based on communication failures from Huntsville Property Managers. The worst of these issues was probably the 11 degree weather with no hot water and no one to contact about it. I called and left several messages and we went without hot water for about 3 days.
I work in property management and I would never recommend this company to anyone. Thankfully the owners of our rental property switched management companies.

resp.text: Ms Hubbard, First of all thank you for letting us know about your concerns. Please know that we take the care of our tenants and the property we manage very seriously. You are correct. We were dealing with major burst pipes all over Huntsville during this time. We called several outside plumbers who were also slammed with frozen pipes. We got out there as soon as possible. We prioritized families with children and the elderly. After that we took care of service calls on a first come basis. One item in your complaint is inaccurate. We were let go due to the excessive amount spent (in the opinion of the owner) making repairs to your home.  I wish you all the best in your new home.

name: Ke Ke
text: I enjoyed my stay with this company. No major issues. I always paid my rent on time. I was never late paying my rent and i expected for them to never be late on providing maintenance service. I put in a request to have a continously stopped up sink and running toilet fixed. Months went by and no one ever came to fix it. When i put in my notice to vacate, then they finally came out to fix it when i was loading my things into a truck. I would definitely rent from them again...

resp.text: Thanks for the review. Unfortunately, we cannot find this name in our tenant rosters, so are unable to specifically address the issues you are reporting. I do not know how you submitted service requests or if the request made it to the proper people,. But, if the requests are made through appropriate channels, we are generally able to get clogged pipes cleared and running toilets rebuilt within a day or two.

name: John Rowe
text: I used these people to manage by  property, never received any of the rent money and they 1099 for the rent money  they kept for themselves. Also the Tenant that occupied the house never paid any of the electric bill which was left in my name. I believe they did this because I'm from the north. A word of warning to all people from the northern states if you own property in Alabama

resp.text:
Mr. Rowe,
None of this is true. This house is in Albertville, an hour and a half away from our office, way too far to be a desirable listing. You begged us to manage this house with your tenants already installed, because you felt all the local people were criminal and corrupt. Against our better judgement we decided to help you out. You didn't want us to send you any rent money while tenant was there, hoping they would buy house and use those funds to help with their closing costs. Your tenants were dead beats, stopped paying rent and were promptly removed. They left the house in terrible shape, with rotting food in fridge, human waste in toilet, old rusting and broken down appliances, a severe cockroach infestation and a property resembling a land-fill with all the construction debris and trash strewn about evenly over an acre of land. The utility bill was attached to their final account with the back rent and other expenses. Their account was referred to collections when they refused to pay what was owed. When they were gone, you wanted us to list this property for sale. We reluctantly agreed to help you here as well. With your permission, we used the meager available funds as best we could to clean property and house for selling. This involved 2 guys over 3 days and 8 round trips with a 30 foot trailer filled with garbage hauled from the property. The house had to be seriously detrashed, scrubbed down and treated for cockroaches. We did the absolute best we would with what funds were available, spending more in fact than what was available in order to clean up completely. But, we were still about $10,000 short of what was needed to get the home ready for habitability, much less marketability and you refused to spend anything more. We 1099 for all the income received and also sent an end of the year statement which itemized all the expenses, leaving you with net income of $0 for tax purposes.

name: Alyssa Feldhaus
text: The worst service. Did not notify me of a $600 water leak in our home. Has made more than one major accounting error. Takes FOREVER to get a response. If I could give 0 stars I would. Sharon butler is only interested in serving those who have expensive homes. We own 3 properties and used this company for one of them simply because I don't have the time to deal with section 8 renting... she apparently doesn't have the time either. Go to management apex instead.

resp.text: I am very sorry you feel this way. The leak you are referring to was a frozen pipe within a wall which could have done major damage. I felt it was an emergency and as such took immediate action to mitigate damage. We actually manage several lower income properties. We absolutely value all our homes and clients no matter the price point. We wish Ms Feldhaus all the best of luck.

name: Charlsie Kirk
text:
RENTER BEWARE - 14020 SANDHURST DR SW
Today I received an email that the property I recently moved out of is back up for rent and $225 more per month than what I was paying. I’m here for this review to warn the next renter of the nightmare that is Darin Bashaw, and how poorly this property has been maintained. First and foremost, false advertisement. This is not a 3 bedroom home. It’s a 2 bedroom (one of which is COVERED in mold) and has a sunroom that directs you to the back yard (that is an uncontrollable BAMBOO FOREST). It is NOT a clean home, but rather the complete opposite. This house is NASTY. When we moved out after only 2.5 months, there were MUSHROOMS growing in the bedroom and bathroom. Absolutely NOTHING was done about a water infiltration issue that we reported to Darin 3 weeks after move-in, which resulted in us having to send an official letter to move out without penalty. As if that weren’t enough, we weren’t informed of the uncontrollable bamboo growing in the yard. When we moved out, the yard was mowed, yet Darin stole $120 of my deposit that he was supposed to return “due to neglect of the yard” THAT HE HADNT EVEN MOWED WHEN HE STOLE MY MONEY. He let that yard grow for TWO SOLID WEEKS after we moved out. The OWNER OF THE HOUSE saw it mowed with his own eyes when he came to check on his house after the CITY came and wrote them up for all kinds of things that needed to be fixed but weren’t. This includes electrical outlets, DRY ROTTED WOOD, poorly sealed doors, the shed out back, and who knows what else. They have not had time to tackle the mold issue since we moved out. I know this because I was there last week 5/13 to get my mail and check out the yard. They hadn’t even cleaned. I know this because the overflowed trash was still sitting in the carport and hadn’t even been taken to the road for pick up. This was such a terrible experience that we now have a lawyer so that we no longer have to deal with this man. I have pictures and videos of this entire experience, which include Darin cussing my husband and being completely irate when we returned the keys. All I can say is TRUST THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS. This man ROBBED me of my deposit and three months worth of rent and let my family move into a MOLD INFESTED HOME. He is a crook and a PITIFUL excuse for a professional. I’m embarrassed for the company he works for. What a terrible representation of a business.

resp.text:
Ms Kirk, I am sorry you were not happy with your home.
You were allowed out of your lease early. The "mold" was categorized by Community Development, who came out as your request, as mildew. Additionally, this was after the massive flooding experienced by all of Huntsville. The list from the city was minimal and so unimportant that they gave us until the end of summer to make repairs. The bamboo was in existence for years and controlled via mowing. You were responsible for the yard. Because you didn't maintain the bamboo is now out of control.  We have rerented the home and have now needed to deal with the bamboo.
Your move in report rated most of the house as acceptable upon move in. Again I am sorry for your experience and wish you all the best.

name: Bob Armstrong
text: They have managed my building for 3 years now and I have 4 words to describe them, responsive, trustworthy, professional and dependable

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Armstrong, we value your business and look forward to many more years together!

name: Eli Allen
text: Huntsville Property Managers helped me rent my house a few years ago when it wouldn't sale. They just arranged for the tenant to purchase, though their Intero affiliate. Couldn't be happier about the 'full service' and great attitude.

resp.text: Thanks Mr. Allen, it was a pleasure doing business with you!

name: Kelly F
text:
Don't waste your time or money.  We're now stuck in a lease and haven't even moved in yet.  Went to view the house on Monday, Dec 3.  On Dec 4 I emailed that we were prepared to pay the deposit for the house and was told "I can probably get it finished up for you to sign the lease on Friday."  Come Friday we heard nothing about whether the house was ready so text the property manager for an update who replies "The lease was ready in the office today. You weren't able to make it?"  Well, no, no one said it was ready.  We meet at their office Saturday to sign the lease, get keys, and of course hand over money...then we go to the house.  Not cleaned.  Text the mgr to let him know it's not clean and he replies "The carpet and linoleum are brand new, so you should be able to move your furniture into the house. I will see if I can get someone back, though it has been cleaned and may not get any cleaner looking."  No, this isn't cosmetic, this is filthy and lazy. That evening I email several pics of the house and receive no reply.  Three days later still no reply so I call him.  I say hello and who I am, to which he replies "yeah?".  I say I'm calling for an update on the house being cleaned.  He says it is clean, just not to MY standards.  He says the carpet and linoleum are new, to which I reply that doesn't mean the house is clean.  I asked him about the pic I sent of the AC return vent.  His reply was that there's a filter.  Oh, so the filth caked up on the outside is ok because there's a filter.  I ask about the storm shelter.  He says they cleared it out.  Well, my pics show otherwise.  I ask about the closet with trash on the shelf and animal hair all over the floor, how a broom has never touched the floors and that I don't want to put my groceries on the filthy pantry shelves.  He replies that he has been doing this a long time, that any other person would've moved in already, how much they have already spent getting the property ready, and that I obviously require extra care so he'll send someone back out tomorrow.  After being insulted I suggested that maybe this isn't the right thing for us and what can we do.  He said we've already signed the lease so nothing.  I asked if this is what we should expect over the course of our lease and he replied that it's up to us, not him, said have a nice day and hung up on me.

**And in response to the records indicating the move in is next weekend and you "agreed" to early move in...that is simply incorrect.  Your records may show that as an estimated date but then why would I be told on Dec 4 that the house could probably be finished up by Friday (Dec 7)?  Doesn't make sense. If the house simply wasn't going to be ready then I would've preferred that answer over being stressed that it really wasn't yet.  But I am very appreciative of the effort to have someone out so quickly to clean.  Hopefully the relationship improves moving forward.

resp.text:
Kelly I am sorry you are unhappy. Our records show you were due to move in next weekend. You asked for a weeks early move in middle of the week. The home was not ready, but we agreed to your early move in. The cleaning person is over there as we speak re cleaning. This was the first opening she had.
The home has new carpet and linoleum.  The storm shelter is an exterior structure. We do not clean those. I am confident you will be comfortable in your new home.

name: Decaurrey Clark
text: Horrible company. Takes weeks to get maintenance requests filled. They half step on everything..

resp.text: This tenant issues are exaggerated and/or not true. She moved into an apartment we had been managing for exactly one day. The first time I looked at unit was when I showed to her, it wasn't ready by our standards to move into, but she had a moving truck full and wanted it immediately. We honored her request and conducted the screening and had new lease prepared the same day, letting her move in to the apartment in existing condition. She complained immediately about a leaking sink drain in kitchen. The property manager himself fixed that sink within an hour. She had a couple of other minor complaints and was instructed to properly submit service requests through the tenant portal, so maintenance can can get on them most efficiently. To date, she has never submitted a service request appropriately. She was quiet until July 18, when she just came back from a trip and said the fridge went out and all her food was spoiled. I was going to send someone to take a look, but she also said it was working again. Next, she started texting the property manager after hours on Friday July 20th, and then angry texting on Saturday the 21st at around bedtime. She was informed that nothing can be done over the weekend and maintenance would check first thing on Monday. Maintenance did go out on Monday and determined the fridge needed to be replace, she also mentioned the water heater didn't work. Water heater was discovered to have a leak at electrical control panel, causing it to short which is something we considered an emergency, and water heater was replaced the same day that Monday. We have contractual obligation to address any non-emergency issues over $300 with owner prior to spending their money. Sometimes it may take a few days to get in touch with the owner for directions, which will delay our repair response time. This owner approved for a new fridge on Tuesday and one was ordered immediately. We also have a fiduciary responsibility to  owners and have found the most expedient and affordable way to get new appliances is to order online, where we can shop the best deals and take advantage of free delivery and hauling of old appliances. When we do order, we always order something in stock for next or 2 day delivery. In this case, for whatever reason, Lowe's needed a couple of extra days but still, a new refrigerator was delivered by the end of the week. We also have a legal responsibility to tenants to address any health and safety issues within a 2 week time frame. Even if we cannot get in touch with owners or get adequate instructions, we will go out of our way to meet our legal obligations, while also meeting our fiduciary obligations. We strongly recommend our tenants carry renters insurance so they can file a claim for any damages or spoiled food.

name: Fred Quiroz
text: Love this company!!!

name: Monday Hale
text: I wish I seen the reviews

resp.text: Ms Hale, I am sorry you are unhappy. Your review, however, gives me no information to go on. I looked through our work orders and didn't see any outstanding. Please let me know what needs are and I will attempt to resolve. Our tenants satisfaction is of course important. Please give me more information. Our office is open and you are welcome to call in and talk with our receptionist.
